body_content.explanation: to put two or more things into a straight line, or to form a straight line:
examples: When you've aligned the notch on the gun with the target, fire!
Align the ruler and the middle of the paper and then cut it straight.
Make sure the columns align in the chart.

body_content.explanation: to be the same or similar, or to agree with each other; to make two things do this:
examples: The post was deleted because it did not align with the values of this website.
The job of an IT business analyst is to align IT systems with changing business needs.
In the first decade of the union, economic growth among member countries was generally aligned.

body_content.explanation: to agree with or support another person, group, organization, or view:
examples: The country's leading intellectuals tend to be aligned with the opposition.
As a musician, he aligned himself with the avant-garde.
The superpowers force smaller countries to align behind them in rival blocs.
